thread.title: Five thrilling yet adventurous honeymoon destinations in India! | Zee News
thread.title_full: Five thrilling yet adventurous honeymoon destinations in India! | Zee News

title: Five thrilling yet adventurous honeymoon destinations in India! | Zee News
text:
Five thrilling yet adventurous honeymoon destinations in India! By Zee Media Bureau | Last Updated: Sunday, February 26, 2017 - 16:48 0 Follow @ZeeNews 
New Delhi: Well, conventional honeymoon destinations are proving to be too dayum mainstream for the new-age couples. Hence, they are thinking out-of-the-box and opting for some thrilling places which offer adrenaline rush as well. You will be amazed to know that there are multiple honeymoon options available in India that also offer activities like scuba diving, skiing, fishing and etc. 
Here are a few adventurous cities you can visit for your honeymoon: 
Manali: It is quite popular among newlyweds. Manali is situated in Himachal Pradesh. It is loaded with daredevil activities like trekking, camping, river rafting and etc. Couples can try these activities in the amazing view of Himachali mountains. 
Shillong: Get swayed away in nature's beauty while doing brave adventures. Shillong is a perfect place to relax amid the mountains and forests. You can go for trekking, swimming, paddleboat ride and much more. Honeymoon in Shillong will surely give you the perfect 'we time' that you needed. 
Goa: The amazing scenery of beaches is awaiting you in Goa. The place is a popular destination for adventure activities. it will give you a perfect honeymoon experience and some unforgettable memories. Couples can try scuba diving, water sports, fishing etc here. 
Lonavala: It is situated in Maharashtra near Mumbai. Lonavala is a place where one can experience the breathtaking sporting experience. You can opt for hot-air balloon, paintball, bungee jumping and etc. A perfect way to bond with your partner. 
Rishikesh: Couples can also visit Rishikesh. The place is popular for its beautiful views of mountains and rivers. Here, the newlyweds can try waterfall trekking, bungee jumping, body surfing, river rafting etc. First Published: Sunday, February 26, 2017 - 16:47 More from zeenews
